page.title: 01THROWLEY AND SURROUNDINGS
page.content: Throwley is on the North Downs about 100 metres above sea level. Several large dry valleys run North towards Faversham. It is a farming area with mostly arable fields, some pasture and deciduous woodland along the valley sides. There is one small village, a few scattered groups of houses, and about 12 farms.The church and school are both outside the village. The roads are not busy but they can be dangerous because many are narrow, have numerous bends and lack pavements. There is no public transport in the area. Residents must visit Faversham for shopping, public amenities like the library, or to join a club. Many people grow their own vegetables at home. There is strong community spirit despite the scattered nature of the population.
